Name: Micro Ancients: Expansion II – Classical Era
Description:
Micro Warfare Series: Micro Ancient Expansion II – Classical Era

An expansion to the popular Micro Ancient game, this title introduces three additional beligerants to enhance play: four additional belligerents to enhance play: Indian, Macedonian, Persian and Seleucid.  The section for each army includes counters for use in the game; applicable rule amendments as well as some brief information about the country at the time (source: Wikipedia)

The Micro Warfare series was originally published by Tabletop Games in the 1970s with this title being published in 1976.  Each game in the series aims to recreate the feel of tabletop wargaming with large numbers of miniatures but using printed counters and terrain so that games can be played in a small space and are very cost-effective

In these new editions we have kept the rules and most of the illustrations unchanged but have modernised the layout and counter designs to refresh the game.  Please look out for more games and expansions from this series being released over the next few months.

—description from the publisher
Families: History: Wars of Alexander the Great
History: Wars of the Diadochi and Syrian Wars

Name: Micro Ancients: Expansion III – Enemies of Rome
Description:
Micro Warfare Series: Micro Ancient Expansion III – Enemies of Rome

An expansion to the popular Micro Ancient game, this title introduces three additional beligerants to enhance play: Britons, Gallic and Goth. The section for each army includes counters for use in the game; applicable rule amendments as well as some brief information about the country at the time (source: Wikipedia)

The Micro Warfare series was originally published by Tabletop Games in the 1970s with this title being published in 1976. Each game in the series aims to recreate the feel of tabletop wargaming with large numbers of miniatures but using printed counters and terrain so that games can be played in a small space and are very cost-effective.

—description from the publisher

Name: Micro Ancients: Expansion IV – Fall of Rome
Description:
Micro Warfare Series: Micro Ancient Expansion IV - Fall of Rome

An expansion to the popular Micro Ancient game, this title introduces four additional belligerents to enhance play: Byzantine, Hun, Late Roman and Sassanid.  
The section for each army includes counters for use in the game; applicable rule amendments as well as some brief information about the country at the time (source: Wikipedia)

The Micro Warfare series was originally published by Tabletop Games in the 1970s with this title being published in 1976.  
Each game in the series aims to recreate the feel of tabletop wargaming with large numbers of miniatures but using printed counters and terrain so that games can be played in a small space and are very cost-effective.

—description from the publisher

Name: Las Ligas de la Ñ Bécquer vs. Irving
Description:
Las Ligas de la Ñ Bécquer vs. Irving is a collection of various card games with a theme inspired by the Romantic writers Gustavo Adolfo Bécquer (1836-1870) and Washington Irving (1783-1859). Bécquer vs. Irving is also the third game of the saga Las Ligas de la Ñ (The Leagues of the Ñ).

This collection of games includes:

     Role-Playing Game. The game´s director rules; the players abide. Learn to be a role master and put the players to the test, making them face stories and rules of your own creation. Once the game is finished the game´s director will choose the best player or team.
     Four Houses. You will be a member of one of the four houses (Chalice, Raven, Lion and Fire). You can be loyal, a mercenary or a traitor.  Speak, negotiate and save your cards to accomplish your goals and make more points than your rivals. You can either be a part of a team or follow your own path.
     Survival.  Make sure you know the game´s characters to survive and make it as far as possible in the game. Sometimes you will need to solve mysteries, or just choose between different paths; from time to time you will get rewards. Prepare to face Bécquer-Irving ´s wrath if you make the wrong choices. 
     Questions. Face different questions about the Bécquer-Irving universe. 
     Storytellers. Create your own stories emulating Bécquer, Irving and other Ñ writers. 
     Contest13. Earn category points using the Ñ value to get at least 13 points in one category. Try to remember the cards included in the decks of all players. If you believe you have achieved the necessary 13 points in one category (Wisdom, Seduction, Politics, Dark force…), check them.  If you do not have 13, you will lose all your cards and will need to start the game from scratch. It is a memory and mathematics game. In this game you will learn to use the categories of every card and the Ñ value. 
     Ultimate Trophy. Are you the chosen one? To win the Bécquer vs Irving Ultimate Trophy you will need to add up more points than your opponents once the six games are finished.  Also, you will be put through a final test: a ten question quiz, they will be selected randomly and you will need to get at least five right. 



    Bécquer vs Irving accepts, to facilitate the game´s playability, any card from any of the two last games (Las Ligas de la Ñ and Las Ligas de la Ñ Galaxia MusiChess.


—description from the designer

Name: Micro Ancients: Expansion V – The Dark Ages
Description:
Micro Warfare Series: Micro Ancient Expansion V – The Dark Ages

An expansion to the popular Micro Ancient game, this title introduces three additional belligerents to enhance play: Norman, Saxon and Viking.  
The section for each army includes counters for use in the game; applicable rule amendments as well as some brief information about the country at the time (source: Wikipedia)

The Micro Warfare series was originally published by Tabletop Games in the 1970s with this title being published in 1976.  Each game in the series aims to recreate the feel of tabletop wargaming with large numbers of miniatures but using printed counters and terrain so that games can be played in a small space and are very cost-effective.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pokémon TCG: Sun & Moon Cosmic Eclipse Expansion
Description:
TAG TEAM cards add a mighty twist to the Pokémon TCG, and Sun & Moon—Cosmic Eclipse mixes things up even more! In addition to new TAG TEAM Pokémon-GX like Solgaleo & Lunala-GX and Naganadel & Guzzlord-GX, there are two new TAG TEAM trios: Togepi & Cleffa & Igglybuff-GX and Arceus & Dialga & Palkia-GX. And for the first time ever, you'll find TAG TEAM Supporter cards like Red & Blue, Cynthia & Caitlin, and Guzma & Hala!

—description from the publisher

Name: Micro Napoleonics: Expansion
Description:
Micro Warfare Series: Micro Napoleonics Expansion

An expansion to the popular Micro Napoleonics game, this title introduces five additional beligerants to enhance play: Polish; Austrian; Russian; Prussian and Spanish.  
The section for each army includes counters for use in the game; organisational charts; applicable rule amendments as well as some brief information about the country at the time of the Napoleonic wars (source: Wikipedia)

The Micro Warfare series was original published by Tabletop Games in the 1970s with this title being published in 1976.  Each game in the series aims to recreate the feel of tabletop wargaming with large numbers of miniatures but using printed counters and terrain so that games can be played in a small space and are very cost-effective.

—description from the publisher

Name: Between a Rock and a Hard Place: A Scenario for A Leader of Men
Description:
Between a Rock and a Hard Place

In 1944 the USMC 1st Division was tasked to attack and secure the island fortress of Pelieu.  The small island had become such a rabbit warren of honeycombed defenses that the USMC spent weeks grinding away at, taking the division close to complete exhaustion as a combat formation.

This scenario booklet looks at the part of that battle, presenting a a scenario for the rules A Leader of Men by TFP Games.  
The scenario put you in control of either USMC or Japanese forces.  
It may also be used as a solo play scenario using the rules in the ALoM rule book.

This scenario is not for the faint of heart, it will require courage and resolution to make it, and sometimes an acceptance that today you may have failed.

This scenario contains:

     a deployment map, 
     scenario orders of battle and 
     special rules.


—description from the publisher

Name: The Great Cake Escape
Description:
In The Great Cake Escape, players take turns pushing tools in between the layers of a three-layer, 3D cake, tools like shovels, chainsaws, and even dynamite! As you try to hide your pieces, you'll push your opponents pieces out — or at least make them visible enough to get caught by the guards. The more you hide, the higher you score!

—description from the publisher

Name: Gloomhaven: The Lucky Meeple (Promo Scenario)
Description:
This is a digital promotional scenario for Gloomhaven created for backers of the Man Vs Meeple Season Two Kickstarter campaign.

The promo consists of two files: one 3-page PDF and a JPG of an event card.

Name: Mixtape Massacre: Lockdown Expansion
Description:
Head back into town with this double-barreled blast of an expansion adding new characters, components, and mechanics to both Mixtape Massacre and Escape From Tall Oaks. Not only does the expansion offer additions to both games, but also elements for use when playing with the games together, adding multiple modes of play.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rebellion: the First Scottish War of Independence
Description:
Rebellion: the First Scottish War of Independence

28mm Wargame rules for Medieval Warfare.

Set in the period of the First Scottish War of Independence, the Rebellion led initially by William Wallace and ending with Robert the Bruce's Victory at Bannockburn, Rebellion is a set of wargaming rules designed to be used with 28mm miniatures.

These rules are designed to be enjoyable and quick to play, with games being completed in one to two hours.  The core rules are covered in the first 30 pages and are not difficult to learn.
This book also includes army lists and warrior and hero profiles as well as suggested scenarios including historical battles such as Stirling and Bannockburn.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wings of War: Midway 1942
Description:
Midway 1942 is a scenario rules supplement for the Wings of War (Wings of Glory) tabletop game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Seven Years: A Wargame
Description:
Seven Years is a war game designed to be simple and efficient.

At the core are: a two-table engine, the five status definition of units, a flexible command system that can span from cumbersome to almost Napoleonic and last not least a more fluid game sequence, than most common rule sets can provide.

While operating at brigade level, it is designed to keep a balance of overall action versus micro management of the troops.

For my taste, so called “friction of battle” is a good thing as long as it doesn‘t bring all action to halt or replaces the player entirely. The game system also gives a bit room to manoeuvre.

Let us trust in the discipline and drill these soldiers were exposed to on a daily basis.

—description from the publisher

Name: Antiquity: Fast Play Miniature Wargames Rules
Description:
Antiquity

Fast play ancients wargames rules.
For 15mm or 25/28mm miniatures.

Turn Sequence:

     Initiative phase
     Movement phase
     Missile phase
     Melee phase
     Morale phase
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Brave Men, Badly Led: 1846 – Napoleon of the West: Miniature Rules for the Mexican-American War 1846-1848
Description:
Brave Men, Badly Led is a series of miniatures rules designed for quick but accurate recreation of the forgotten battles of the last three centuries.

Utilizing miniatures and an innovative event deck, no two games are ever the same.

Designed for 15mm forces, but can be easily adapted to the scale of your choice.

No rebasing required!

—description from the publisher

Name: Final Combat: Flower of Our Youth – Vietnam War Skirmish Scenarios for Final Combat
Description:
Flower of Our Youth is a supplement for the Final Combat Skirmish System.

It contains 14 missions within 7 different operations that cover a period from 1965 to 1975 during the Vietnam War.

It also introduces rules for "booby traps," new armored fighting vehicle data sheets and assorted small arms of the period.

—description from the publisher

Name: SOF Warrior: 21st Century Skirmish Rules for Role-Playing and Miniatures 15mm to 54mm
Description:
In spite of the darkness, the SOF Warrior’s NODs enabled him to see a lone sentry armed with an AK-47 sitting approximately 75 meters away.  
Suddenly, the man stood up and the SOF operative froze in place.  
He cursed under his breath as he realized something must have betrayed his presence.  
Although, he was certain he had not been spotted, the man began to run. The operative knew he was intended to be an early warning, and soon the other insurgents would be alerted.

Instinctively, his finger found the pressure pad on the fore grip of his M4 Carbine which activated the infrared laser sight, and in an instant the target was tracked.  
With no time to attain a “cheek weld” he squeezed the trigger…
...and the player rolled the dice!

SOF Warrior is the modern version of Final Combat, and although it is designed around elite special forces, it plays brilliantly with regular formations.  
This squad-level simulation includes many of the current weapons platforms.  
Add an armored fighting vehicle to your squad and enjoy the most exciting close quarters battle experience for role-playing and miniatures available today.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mission Command: Normandy – Reference Manual
Description:
Mission Command: Normandy is a set of World War Two wargaming rules for use with miniatures.

The Mission Command approach:

     Captures the essence of tactical and operational combat command from roughly company level to division level without real warfare's bloodshed, fear, death and destruction.
     Models the differences in how different armies fight.
     Reflects WW2 practice of tactical and operational command, control and communications.


With Mission Command: Normandy, if you're handling a German Panzer Division, it will be a different experience from handling an equivalent British or American unit.

Command, control and communications are not as abstracted as in most modern wargames - no command dice, no PIPs and no artificial 'fog of war' mechanisms. 
Each command of company level or above is given orders at the start which can be modified later, but orders are brief.

Fog of war, imperfect information and sometimes confusion emerge naturally as players attempt to fight in accordance with national doctrines and complex tactical situations.

—description from the publisher

Name: Micro Melee
Description:
Micro Melee is a rules system for recreating company level engagements of WWII.

Although the basis for these rules is the Company, it all begins with the infantry squad.

Each squad is rated according to the volume of fire it can generate. This rating is known as the fire power factor.

The rules use a chit-based activation system, in which each chit represents ten seconds of worthwhile combat time.  
The ensuing game-play is known as an action phase, and it includes identification, movement and combat for all activated units.

The game represents a snapshot of the most important moments, and is in no way intended to chronicle an entire engagement.

Micro Melee offers a tactical challenge that is rarely
experienced on a gaming table.  
It is written for 6-15mm miniatures, using a 1:1 ground scale.  
This has been the hallmark of Britton Publishers' four rule sets.

—description from the publisher

Name: Micro Melee: Modern Warfare – Company Level Rules for 6mm Miniatures
Description:
Micro Melee: Modern Warfare is a rules system for post WWII, company level engagements.

It uses the Micro Melee mechanics, but adds a modern twist.

It includes SOF teams, armor, antitank guided missiles, helicopters, SAM, CAS counter-battery artillery and much more.

—description from the designer

Name: Mini Paintball
Description:
If you've played paintball, you've probably found it to be hot, sweaty and painful.

Mini Paintball is none of those things!

Let your table top be the speedball field, let your little lead people take the pain, and cheat just like players do in the real game!

But don't let the Marshal see you do it or you could be expelled from the field!

—description from the publisher

Name: Twister Scrabble
Description:
This Twister game has a Scrabble twist. Instead of large colored circles, this Twister mat has printed Scrabble letter tiles. The designated judge spins the spinner and calls out a challenge based on where it lands, and then chooses a starting letter. Then the twisting, shouting, and laughing begins! Players place their hands and feet on the mat to make a word. Then depending on where the spinner has landed, they try to be the first to shout out, spell out, or use the word in a sentence to win the round. It's an exiting, active party game in which players use their hands and feet…and brain!

—description from the publisher

Name: Sitz Krieg ohne Hass: WWII Corps level wargame rules
Description:
SitzKrieg ohne Hass is an innovative fast-paced game placing the player in the role of the commander of a WW2 Corps or Army.

The game is about command, control and planning. 
Good planning, effective control of your artillery, use of Division and Corps level assets, and use of the night turn to reorganise will all maximise your chances of success. 
And use your reconnaissance screen to uncover enemy forces and gain the initiative.

A grid based battlefield regulates all firing and movement eliminating any micro-measurement. 
No record keeping is required.

A Corps game can easily be fought through in three hours.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cruel Seas: Close Quarters
Description:
Close Quarters! includes eleven new historic scenarios, spanning the seas of this global conflict as well as a random scenario generator. 
Also included are expanded ship rosters for the seafaring nations and new rosters for the Finnish Navy and Yugoslav Partisan Fleet. 
New rules for amphibious invasions and experimental Q-ships are presented as well as expanded rules for aircraft and submarines.

Close Quarters is a supplement for Cruel Seas, the 1/300 scale tabletop wargame of World War Two naval battles.

A copy of the Cruel Seas rulebook is needed to use this supplement.

—description from the publisher

Name: Black Seas: Merchant Vessels
Description:
Merchant vessels were not designed for combat. They were slow lumbering vessels designed to have a large capacity for transporting goods but at the sacrifice of manoeuvrability.

In Black Seas there are many scenarios that necessitate the use of merchant vessels. 

     Scenario 4 - Blood & Plunder! (Page 41 Black Seas rulebook), see two opposing privateer fleets attempt to claim the contents of merchant vessels for their own, whereas 
     Scenario 9 - Landing Expedition (Page 46 Black Seas rulebook) sees merchant vessels loaded with troops attempting to cross hostile waters and disgorge their loads onto a contested island.


For an alternative use of the merchant vessels, consider the Smugglers Run free downloadable campaign.

—description from publisher

Name: Black Seas: Spanish Navy 1st Rate
Description:
First-rate ships of the line are the ultimate vessel in Black Seas. These ships pack a tremendous punch and can take quite the pummelling. Any enemy unfortunate enough to be caught in the broadside of a 1st Rate is not likely to be around long enough to take the tale. 1st Rates also have access to the greatest quantity and wealth of customisation and upgrade options in the game.

Spanish 1st Rates are especially characterful when utilising the national special rules in the game. Many Spanish vessels were extremely heavily armed, and thus can take the ’Over Gunned’ upgrade for no additional cost. This bonus does not come without penalty however, as such bulky ships were difficult to sail. They must therefore pass a skill test when attempting to sail at a quicker rate of knots. Veteran crews are also not allowed to be taken on such ‘Over Gunned’ 1st Rates ships.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cruel Seas: Run Silent, Run Deep
Description:
In Cruel Seas we intentionally wanted submarines to work as a normal surface vessel. After all, powerful diesel engines propel them as fast, if not faster, than many escort ships in a convoy when surfaced.

The bonus for a submarine is, of course, being able to vanish by diving, hiding from escorts to ambush the merchantmen at will.

The disadvantage of being submerged is the slow speed and the fact you are often blind to what is going on at the surface, that’s when the game of cat and mouse begins!

Run Silent, Run Deep is an unofficial expansion to Cruel Seas that expands upon the submarine rules presented in the core book. Track the depth and position of your submarine with a series of easy to read markers. Send your opponent off on a wild goose chase, haring after shadows and transients while your submarine slips through his defensive line to attack lumbering merchantmen.

While games on the surface are a breakneck affair with chattering cannons and exploding shells, Run Silent, Run Deep is a game of stealth and patience - building to a nail-biting finale when escort and submarine clash one-on-one.

—description from the publisher

Name: The United States Naval War College 1936 Wargame Rules: USN Wargaming Before WWII Volume 1
Description:
This book makes the 1936 edition of the tactical rules readily accessible for the first time to the public. It includes detailed rules for movement, gunnery, and other aspects of real naval warfare from the big gun era. The object of these games was to aid students of strategy and tactics in the comprehension of these complex subjects.

The book includes:
Original guidance from 1922 on how to play the game
Sample gunnery tables
Torpedo fire cards 
Rules for visibility and smoke
Details about speed and fuel
Sample ship cards to illustrate how the rules worked

—description from the publisher

Name: At Lances Point: Living Rule Book
Description:
At Lances Point is a multi-period spanning tabletop wargame.

These cut down rules will give you all you need to play a basic game of ALP to get a sense of what the full game will be. 
It combines cards with 15mm miniatures on a realistic gaming table set up to give you exciting and immersive battles of ancients right through to modern day. 
This initial phase will concentrate on ancient and medieval periods but on full release, there will be additional sets for Napoleonic, American Civil War and many more.

The game combines combat cards with unit actions to give a unique game so be sure to get the card sets you need.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ins bayrische Hochland
Description:
Ins bayrische Hochland ("To the Bavarian highlands") is a vintage typical roll and move board game about traveling through the Bavarian highlands. The first player, who cross all 80 stops first wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Robin Hood: The Sheriffs Revenge
Description:
Robin Hood: The Sheriffs Revenge turns Robin Hood: Hero of the People into an asymmetric 2 player battle for Nottingham.

One person plays as Robin Hood and his merry men while other plays as the Sheriff of Nottingham, each battling to complete their own objective. Robin Hood is trying to help the villagers of Nottingham by giving them money stolen from the rich and corrupt. The Sheriff is trying to increase the bounty on Robin's head to 1000 gold coins.

The game is played in rounds consisting of 5 phases.

The first phase is the Rob from the rich phase where the Robin player draws and selects resources from the loot deck.

The second phase is the action phase where the Robin player can use resources to take a number of actions including building Sherwood Forest and giving to the poor.

The third phase is the duel phase. Both players select a character to enter into battle and simultaneously reveal. If the Robin character can and beat the Sheriff character by equalling the villain's skill level, they earn a reward. If they can't they gain a penalty.

The fourth phase is the Sheriffs Revenge phase. The Sheriff player can then do a number of actions Including raising the bounty, arresting heroes and oppressing the poor.

The final phase is the event phase where the Sheriff player draws 2 event cards and chooses one to play.

The game ends when one player objectives are achieved or the last card of the event deck is drawn.

—description from the designer
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Robin Hood

Name: Robin Hood: Legends
Description:
Robin Hood: Legends adds a campaign mode to Robin Hood: Hero of the People.

Played over 6 stories or legends, you recruit your merry men, rob from the rich to give to the poor and fight the Sheriff and his guards.

Each legend has it's own victory condition, however, failure to complete a legend doesn't eliminate you from the game.

Can you play through each legend to beat the Sheriff of Nottingham at the end before the bounty on your head reaches 1000 gold pieces?

—description from the designer

Name: Hunt for the Ring: Light and Shadow
Description: Light and Shadow is the first expansion for Hunt for the Ring and will introduce four new characters from the initial chapters of The Lord of the Rings into the game.

Name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Ryan Funkhouser Promo Card
Description:
A new free agent to add to the free agent deck for Baseball Highlights: 2045.

Released as part of the Promo Paradise Kickstarter campaign (2019).

Name: US Naval War College War Gaming Manual with scenario
Description:
This is a complete set of rules with a scenario for a sample scenario for modern (as of 1969) naval warfare using: surface-to-air missiles (SAMs), gunnery, air, torpedoes and mines, etc.

The rules cover game setup, damage assessment, and game play.

The sample game gives the background and briefings and the two sides ORBATs. Then it sets out the plans of the two sides. It goes on to set out how the game is setup, managed and played.

The rules are supported by numerous examples of the forms used to manage the game, such damage assessment flowcharts and surface to air missile assessment flowcharts. There is sufficient information for the modern wargamer to understand how the game was conducted or to recreate the games for themselves.

reprinted without any updates in 2019 as "United States Naval War College Manual Wargaming (1969): Wargames at the Start of the Missile Era"

Name: Tsunami Island: Battle Royale
Description:
Your hero is on an island fighting against the heroes of other players. The game propose you 6 heroes that got different skills.
The island you're on is made of tiles from 4 types:

     Volcano
     Beach
     Jungle
     Lagoon


Each type will provide bonuses or weakness to your heroes.

As a "Battle Royale" game you will loot weapons and objects on the map to better fight against your enemies.

Name: Steampunk Rally: Lizzie Magie
Description:
Activation: Place any two dice with matching pip values to gain 3 movement.

Bonus: You have 3 "Hotel" tokens (borrowed from another game on your shelf).

At the end of each Race Phase, each opponent must pay you 2 cogs per Hotel on their current Track Tile. If they cannot pay, they must discard machine parts with cogs showing in the corner (if they have any), gaining those cogs from the supply, until they have enough to pay.

Then, you may place a die showing pips equal to or greater than the number of opponents in the game (max. 6) from your Pool onto the Hotel Dice Slot to place a Hotel token in the corner of any Track Tile. If you place a Hotel on a tile with no other Hotels, you must reclaim any previously placed Hotels. The die used can be vented later as normal.


Lizzie Magie was a writer, comedian, actress, engineer, feminist, and political activist best known for creating The Landlord's Game, intended to illustrated the ills of land grabbing and the unfair advantages of property ownership and exploitative rent practices. The game developed a cult following with many fans of creating their own game boards, including a group of Quakers in Atlantic City. Three decades after it's creation, Parker Brothers published this version with the title "monopoly" (with the political message sanitized), and the rest is board game history!

Name: Cedar Point-opoly
Description:
For more than 130 years, Cedar Point has been the favorite amusement park of thrill-seekers, family vacationers, and live show audiences. But don't let its age fool you! Every year it gets older, is a year it gets better!

As the coaster capital of the world - Cedar Point takes its guests to new heights, unbelievable twists, upside down turns, and speeds beyond compare! The Top Thrill Dragster, Millennium Force, and the Magnum XL-200, to name a few, are coasters without equal the world over.

You can't forget that this fantastic fun place offers a special playland for kids and families, waster oases, award-winning shows, and games galore!

So choose you token and roll the dice. Who knows? You may be the next big star at the Palace Theatre or racing through the dark on the Disaster Transport. It sounds easy enough, but add a trip to First Aid and lose your change on the Chaos, and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun!

Looking for a virtual visit to the largest amusement ride park in the world? Here it is!

—description from the publisher

Name: Salnave's War: Ship Data and a Campaign System for "Dahlgren and Columbiad" and "Iron and Fire"
Description:
Salnave's War: Wargaming The Haitian Civil War 1867-69 is a supplement for "Dahlgren and Columbiad" and A&AGE's "Iron and Fire" covering the naval side of the Haitian Civil War, 1867-69.

The supplement contains ship data for both sets of rules for all of the warships involved in the war, and a short campaign system based on "War of the Pacific" that focusses on the essential aspects of the war.

—description from the publisher

Name: Culture Collection Expansion
Description:
The Culture Collection Expansion contains 31 additional cards for Keep, Merchants of Muziris, and Neolithic which were unlocked during the initial funding campaign.

Keep:
6 character cards & 4 item cards.

Merchants of Muziris:
2 market cards.  4 produce cards.  4 character cards.

Neolithic:
2 Explore cards, 1 Developed Resource card, 2 Gathered Resource cards, 3 Hunt cards

Name: Made the Cut! Golf Game
Description:
Made the Cut! is a statistically accurate shot by shot simulation of the PGA Tour. Each of the 2019 set golfers are unique and will perform according to various individual golf statistics provided they play a similar golf schedule as in real life. Each golfer was rated for their driving ability, ability to hit greens, short game and putting. The courses have been rated for each round of play and each hole, based on the 2019 statistics. This helps capture easy or tough pin placements; good or bad weather conditions and easy or hard holes in general.

Made the Cut! includes a risk/reward strategy option for the player when taking approach shots to the Green. You can choose to play standard, with no adjustments to the Golfer card or you can choose to Pin Hunt (PH) or Safe Play (SP).  PH reduces golfer’s chance to hit the green in regulation, but if they do, the golfer has a greater chance of sinking the putt. However, a missed Green is on the “wrong side", adding pressure to golfer’s Short Game play. On the other hand, a golfer choosing to SP will find it easier to hit the green in regulation, but leave a longer than normal putt. However, a missed Green is on the “right side”, taking pressure away from golfer's Short Game play.

Play a single golfer through his 2019 PGA Tour schedule, maybe just a handful of contenders or all players that Made the Cut! Play only the Majors, a handful of events or the entire season.

The 2019 PGA Season Set includes approximately 260 golfers who earned at least a single Fedex point throughout the 2019 season AND played enough holes to record accurate statistics. It also includes courses and tournament information for all 44 events played out each weekend of the 2019 PGA Season, including complete fields!

—description from the designer

Name: Minnesota-Opoly
Description:
It’s full of big adventures, sparking lakes, Minnesota Charm and of course...a legendary lumberjack - a little something for every Minnesotan! Looking for a fun way to experience the Gopher State?

Buy your favorite MINNESOTA properties, increase your rent by collecting Cabins and trading them in for Lodges. Sound easy? Well, add in snowfall, mashed potato wrestling and the IRS and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! GET YOUR GAME ON!

So choose your token and advance to GO MINNESOTA! You may soon be the Governor of Minnesota … or out of the game for eating too many Jucy Lucy's! THIS IS MINNESOTA.... AND IT’S YOUR ROLL!

—description from the publisher

Name: Ein Fall für Perry Clifton
Description:
One player (Perry Clifton) pursues up to 4 burglars. Each piece moves on it'ts own track. Movement is determined by a die.
Each space on the game board represents 1 minute. The burglars have a 10 minute headstart. If Perry Clifton overtakes a burglar, the burglar is caught and eliminated from the game. If a burglar reaches space 88 he has escaped. Perry Clifton may use up to 10 stop-chips to put on the track in front of the burglars instead of rolling the die to move himself forward. The burglars may only pass the chip if they land on the same space it occupies.
The results of the game are documented on a piece of paper. After each player has played Perry Clifton once, the results are compared and the player who caught the most burglars in the shortest time wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Rund um die Tankstelle
Description:
One player represents the ESSO gas station attendant (red car) and another a fee dodger (black car). The other players are ordinary car diivers. The attendant starts at space 8, all other players at space 16. Movement is determined by a die. The ESSO attendant has the task to handle the moveable shortway in the center of the game board. If a player gets onto a service point (spacees 1 to 6) he has to pay with a Service coupon of which the players have 6 at the beginning of the game. The fee podger uses the service points without paying. When the fee dodger uses the second service station, all other players start to pursue him. Only at this point the attendant enters the game too. If a player captures the fee dodger he gets 1 point and the fee dodger starts again on space 16.

The game ends, when all players have used all 6 of their coupons and the fee dodger is captured for the last time. The player with the most points wins the game.
—user summary

Name: Stick Six
Description:
"Pop Pop Pop Pop Pop Pop! Stick this suction cups to the translucent honeycomb board and try to get six in a row before your opponent!

Start with a giant clear playing board, then start strategizing. You’ll be sticking here and sticking there as you lay out a few options to Stick Six of your own, all while blocking the other players. Whether it’s in a circle, a straight line, or a diagonal – the first player to stick six in a row wins!"

—description from the publisher

Name: The Zorro Dice Game: Heroes and Villains
Description:
This first expansion to The Zorro Dice Game broadens the player count in both direction bringing it down to 1 player and up to 8 players. It has more villains, more scoundrels, more premium equipment, and more common equipment. Whereas the base game kept everything very simple and straightforward, the expansion adds some more complexity, which also opens up more opportunity for combos and strategies.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blücher: Holy Mother Russia
Description:
The army of the Tsar of all the Russias was a tough, disciplined force, armed to the teeth with plentiful artillery. They proved to be formidable opponents for Napoleon’s armies, and ultimately victorious over his attempt to conquer their homeland.

Holy Mother Russia is a set of 58 unit cards, providing all of the Russian unit cards for Blücher. This set contains all of the units and officers that you need to create a Russian army for Blücher or for a Scharnhorst campaign.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blücher: König und Vaterland
Description:
The Prussian army of 1806 was a well-trained and disciplined force with many excellent units, but they were famously defeated by Napoleon at Jena and Auerstädt. Animated by vengeance, the reformed Prussian army was instrumental in Napoleon’s ultimate defeat.

Two Armies in One Box:

König und Vaterland (king and fatherland) is a set of 95 unit cards that allow you to build either/both the Prussian armies for Blücher and for Scharnhorst campaigns. All the units and officers from both the early- and late-war armies are included.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blücher: Kaiserlicks
Description:
During the wars of the French Revolution, the French called their Austrian enemies “kaiserlicks,” a mispronunciation of the German word for “imperial.” The humble kaiserlick was a well-trained and well-equipped soldier, the most consistent and frequent enemy of the French Republic and Empire.

Kaiserlicks is a set of 67 richly colorful heavy-duty poker-sized cards, covering the army of the Austrian Empire. This set contains all of the units and officers that you need to create an Austrian army for Blücher or for a Scharnhorst campaign.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blücher: Sunset of the Ghazis
Description:
The Ottomans were the “eternal empire” that sprawled across three continents, a vast, multi-ethnic polity with a huge army. By the time of Napoleon they had been driven from the northern Balkans and most of North Africa, but they were still a major player in Eurasian affairs and a force that had to be reckoned with. Ottoman soldiers were tough and stubborn, and the Sultan’s vast armies included huge contingents of light cavalry.

Sunset of the Ghazis is a set of 76 unit cards, providing all of the Ottoman unit cards for Blücher. This set contains all of the units and officers that you need to create an Ottoman army for Blücher or for a Scharnhorst campaign.

—description from the publisher

Name: Windstärke 6
Description:
The players have to get their merchant ships from their home harbor to the destination harbor of the same color and back again. The war ships are used to attack enemy ships and defend their own ships. In the center of the game board is a island with two safe neutral harbors. The player harbors are guarded by coast artillery.

Movement is determined by a color die and a standard number die. The color die decides which of the three windroses (red = strong wind, blue = medium wind, yellow = weak wind) is used whereas, the number die defines the wind direction.

The game ends when all surviving merchant ships are back in their home harbor or if a player has no war ships left. At the end of the game points for reaching a harbor or surviving war ships are awarded and the player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Hobiti: Dlouhé svátky
Description: 112 cards that can serve as an expansion to Hobiti or a stand-alone game.

Name: Kontaê!: Heroínas negras brasileiras
Description:
An educational game for Brazilian students. The game introduces four influential black Brazilian women on three types of cards: One shows an image, others show biographical information, and some have poems about the women. The poems were written by Brazilian author Jarrid Arraes, whose book Heroínas negras brasileiras was an inspiration for the game.

Each group of students gets an image card and has to research the life of that respective personality (there is a QR code on the image cards which leads to a page with information). After the research phase, each group receives three random cards. The goal is to have a set of cards which all belong to their initial personality. But the poem and biography cards do not show the name of the personality, the students have to figure out which information or poem belongs to their character. The groups can exchange cards with a drawpile or with an open display of cards. Whichever group gets a full set first, wins. 
A competitive mode is also included. In this mode, the teacher teaches about one personality, then deals out the cards to the students who have to figure out which cards belong to the character they learned about.
The game is available to teachers as a free print and play.

Name: GeekmeQuiz: Le Retour
Description: GeekmeQuiz: Le Retour will test your geek culture. Choose your specialty from 6 themes: cinema, comics, japanimation and manga, video games, literature and TV shows. Combine your skills with those of your friends to answer many questions!

Name: Ice Duo
Description:
Ice Duo is a collection of two "pyramid" games: IceDice and Twin Win.

• Twin Win is played on a 3x3 grid, with players trying to match stacks of pyramids to one of two hidden goal cards dealt to each player at the start of play. Players have two ways to win, ergo Twin Win.

• IceDice is a press-your-luck game in which you want to complete three matching sets of pyramids by rolling dice; if you can't get the pyramids you want from the bank, you can possibly steal them from your opponent.

Name: Mournequest: Nightmare Add-on Pack
Description: Get two brand new Nightmares to play against, the Sheerie and Pookah, complete with their Nightmare Discs and evil abilities. You also get four sculpted Treasure pots.

Name: Wingspan: Oceania Expansion
Description:
Wingspan: Oceania Expansion focuses on birds in Australia and New Zealand. It's designed by Elizabeth Hargrave and features birds illustrated by Natalia Rojas and Ana Maria Martinez.

In this second expansion to Wingspan colorful and awe-inspiring birds from Oceania are added. The Oceania bird cards are designed to be shuffled into the bird cards from the base game, with or without other expansions.

This expansion includes new player mats and a new food type, allowing players to explore different strategies in this new environment. It also includes new bonus cards and more end-of-round goals, as well as a new color of egg. In addition, it includes a two-player cooperative variant that adapts the solo rules to allow a team of two to play against a game-controlled opponent.
Families: Misc: Watch It Played How To Videos

Name: Guns 'n Grenades
Description:
Ever wanted to play a wargame but don't have time for expensive miniatures and massive rulebooks? 
Well here's your solution!

Guns 'n Grenades is a wargame that uses generic plastic army men as the miniatures.

The rules are simple and effective, allowing you to fight on levels as small as squad vs. squad or even as big as entire armies fighting!

Combat is simple, running on dice rolls and luck.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Wooden Hand of Captain Danjou: The French Foreign Legion at Camerone
Description:
On April 30, 1863, 3rd Company, 1st Battalion of the Legion Etrangere fought hordes of Mexican Regulars at the Battle of Camerone. 
They Lost. 
But in losing they created the legend of Camerone, of single-minded dedication to the cause, even in the face of insurmountable odds. 
Camerone Day is celebrated by the Legion every April 30.

In celebration of the 152nd anniversary, Pulp Action Library is bringing out The Wooden Hand of Captain Danjou, a game about grit, determination, and terrible accents. 
The players take on the personae of the French characters, and have all the odds stacked in their favor except one - there are too many Mexicans.

The idea is not to survive, but to die in the best way possible!

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Outlaws of Sherwood: Adventure in the Time of Robin Hood
Description:
Everyone knows Robin Hood. 
Outlaws of Sherwood lets you play the tales of the legendary outlaw and his dastardly foes, from one-on-one fights to whole campaigns with multiple forces. You can raise your own outlaw band, or become a proud knight with his retinue of men-at-arms. 
As Robin you can win archery contests, disguise yourself in unlikely ways, and get knocked off a log by people you just met. As the wicked sheriff, you can oppress the peasants, chase Merry Men through the Greenwood, and do that evil laugh you always wanted to do.

The core rules are simple, designed for new wargamers of all ages to pick up and play. 
A card deck decides who moves next. 
You can play other special cards to – say – dress up as a washerwoman and have nobody say you aren't. 
Combat is based on PAL's card version of Rock-Paper-Scissors, where you can jump back or leap aside from a blow, or taunt your opponent with insults.

Additional rules allow for personalising your own 'faction' for good or evil, and developing your characters and their followings through a series of games.

We include a whole set of scenarios, from simple 'starter' encounters to full-blown multi-player battles. 
You can play out a full ongoing campaign where your heroes and their followers gain success and reputation – or don't. And, if you want to take the outlaw motif beyond Sherwood, the campaign system can be moved to the Scots or Welsh borders, the marshes of East Anglia, or Ireland.

There's a history of the real Robin Hood, sources for figures, and a listing of books, movies and television shows.

If you want to rob from the rich and give to the poor, or simply keep it all yourself, Outlaws of Sherwood is the game for you!

The PDF version of the game includes the Special Action Cards and the PAL Medieval action Deck, giving you all the components you need to play the game (minus figures, terrain, dice, a table and a opponents).

—description from the publisher
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Robin Hood

Name: Battle Troll: Man-to-Man Combat as depicted in the Icelandic Sagas
Description:
Battle Troll, game of Icelandic Sagas.

The man thrust at Gisli with a spear, but Gisli struck off the spear-head from the shaft with his axe, and the blow was so stout that the axe passed on to the rock beneath, and one horn of the edge broke off. Then he throws away the axe and clutches his sword and fights with it, and shields himself with his shield. They attack him bravely, but he kept them off like a man...

- The Saga of Gisli Sursson

The world of the sagas is a world of proud and irascible men with touchy tempers and big axes, and how their bad manners as tourists are matched by an astonishing inability to get along with the neighbors. It’s like the Wild West, without the schoolmarm and the preacher, held on a cold windy coastline.

It's about blood-feuds, and raids, and quarrels, and blood-feuds, and stealing other people's stuff and taking one another to the rowdiest courts in the world, and blood-feuds, and being exiled to the far-flung reaches of the world and behaving just as badly there. It's about visiting other lands, meeting interesting people, and hacking them about with ironmongery and looting churches because that's where the gold and silver are kept. It's about you, me, Onund the dog-faced and his foster father Sven going over to see the farmer across the river to tell him exactly what we think of him.

Personal combat in the Norse sagas is notable for its combination of grim humor, gymnastic violence and a graphic interest in the details of wounds, especially those with fatal consequences. 
Battle-Troll is all about that, a fast, bloodthirsty game simple enough to play after several horns of mead. Stolen mead, from a looted monastery.

Also available: Battle Troll Action Deck: 52 cards - 4 sets of player turn cards; two End of Turn cards; and two complete Combat decks, with Attack and Defense strategies and card-sized Combat Results table.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ironsides: Being a set of rules for the larger actions of the Great Civil War in England
Description:
Ironsides

English Civil War game.

Note that this game is not edited or laid out more than is necessary. That's why it's free!

—description from the publisher

Name: Eat Hitler: A game of time travel and well-deserved comeuppance
Description:
Eat Hitler - The Nazi Taste Treat

Berlin 1945: When Hitler and his cronies use a time machine to evade the final Soviet attack, things go from bad to ---- something else! 
In a Jurassic landscape, each player portrays a dinosaur intent on snacking on these yummy jackbooted appetizers. 
Your aim is to gain points by chomping down Nazis – and some are worth more than others – then move the surviving Aryan supermen so that other players have a hard time reaching them. 
Move a brontosaurus as an obstacle, or have a stegosaurus thwack at passing leaders of the Third Reich with his tail!

It’s an hour of wacky anti-fascist fun. 
Bring your own plastic dinosaurs, tiny Nazis, dice and sense of humour.

—description from the publisher

Name: Advanced Impetus
Description:
Advanced Impetus

Free pdf with:

     amendments, 
     errata, 
     clarifications and 
     tournament rules 


for Impetus rulebook

—description from the publisher

Name: Woodlings
Description:
Woodlings is a cultish, animal-infested game of murder, bluffing and elder-beings in the classic “Mafia” format.
Each player controls two Woodlings, little forest creatures each with their own abilities and attributes that they can use to their advantage.
The game revolves around Ancients, powerful, age-old woodland spirits that require specific sacrifices from their followers in order to stay sated.
At the start of the game, one Woodling will be anonymously designated the Killer, whose goal is to sacrifice two other Woodlings to an Ancient (of their choosing) without being caught.
Every other Innocent Woodling must in turn use their own abilities and deduction skills to collectively pinpoint the Killer before they accomplish their goal.

The game takes play over three stages
The Night stage
The Discussion stage
And the Voting stage

The game ends if

The Killer is accused (Innocent victory)
The Killer for whatever reason cannot carry out their sacrifices (Innocent victory)
The Killer sacrifices two appropriate Woodlings and is not accused the next day (Killer victory)

—description from the designer

Name: Water Journey
Description:
Water Journey is a educational board game learning about water supply and management.
Players are the otter team who have to develop and deliver water matching with the requirement form the people or industries in Water Land.

Different water demands effect different water pollution. This game used the research about the water pollution data in Thailand as a balance in game.

This game will end when all player's manager finish 2nd rounds (as 2 years)

Component
1. Water land Map x 1
2. Player board x 6
3. Water container x 12
4. Worker x 13
5. Manager x 6
6. Pollution tracker x 6
7. Requirement card x  42
8. Event card x 20
9. Water token x 120
10. Polluted water token x 20
11. River bag and Ground water bag x 2

Game play

Side of board indicate the time tracker. Player, who has manager on the least time tracker, plays their turn.

On player turn, player has 2 workers and they can develop the water by place their worker on the factory (such as placing on river pump to get the water to to container, or placing on next level follow the pipe line to develop to next level). Each factory use different time then move player's manager on time tracker.

if player has water match with quantity and quality, player can place their worker to deliver water. and reveal their demand card on hand to finish the demand.

After all players finish their 2nd board-round, the game finish and check ther score. The score is from [player's finished demand cards] - [pollution track]. if player has the hightest pollution track, they get penalty by count all pollution water in river bag and ground-water bag as minus point.

Finally, Player who has the highest point win the game.

Name: "Auf die Plätze" ... unser Chemnitz-Spiel
Description:
The aim of this game is to occupy sights (places) of Chemnitz and get the most points.

The starting player draws a location card and places it at the corresponding location. This marks the start location for everyone. Everyone moves to a location (sight) during the first turn starting from the start location. Every time someone moves, a location has to be reached.

Movements are allowed in one direction only (shortest path): to the side, forwards, or diagonal. A chip gets placed in each tile. This applies to the target location as well. For each path up to six chips can be used. An already occupied tile can be skipped, but not a location or multiple occupied tiles. For each location up to 4 chips (own or foreign) are allowed, but only one per turn. After occupying a location the current player can (but does not have to) draw a location card and auction it.

A chip gets payed to the register and the card is auctioned. Up to 6 chips can be offered. If somebody offers six chips, the auction stop immediately. An auctioned location card can be used starting with the next round. Starting with the second turn, each player can choose: Either walk and auction or "cap". This means that one location card is placed on the corresponding location, or another location. When capping, you can place as much chips on the location card as there are beneath it. A "capped" location is locked.

The "i" wild card can be used to either "cap" a chosen location, the "IHK" wild card to get the own chips back from the register immediately. If it is passed on, the receiving player has to take back all of its own chips from the register. If the "i" wild card is drawn, the "i-Chemnitz-Service" will be the start location. When starting from the start location is not possible any more, because all the tiles around it are occupied already, another location card gets drawn as the start location. The game ends when someone runs out of chips.

Scoring: Only "capped" tiles with at least one chip on it get scored. For correctly "capped" tiles all chips are counted for the corresponding person. For incorrectly "capped" tiles only chips of the "capping" person are counted, and only if the player has at least one chip beneath the location tile. All other chips are lost. Some special points can be gained by having matched places you wrote down before the start of the game.

Name: Imagimarium New Year
Description:
Hooray, gift edition!

Imaginarium beloved by everyone in a compact New Year's performance - this is a ready-made gift! It contains the best winter and holiday illustrations from all previous sets, but there are also new, new cards - as many as 11 pieces,
they can be mixed with any set except the Jubilee. If you add a few, you get a very different Imaginarium, It has all the components for an independent game. This is a simple association game that everyone likes - this is an excellent reason to save a couple of boxes for the winter holidays.

Rules of the game:

Each player chooses a chip and a set of voting cards in the same color as the chip.

Definition of the first move

You must determine who will walk first. You can use voting cards for this. All participants take their voting cards, shuffle and draw out any card at random. The first to start is the one who pulled out the card with the highest number. You can use any other mechanics to select the player starting first. For example, we play this right in chess. Then the game goes clockwise.

Game progress

All player chips are set to 1.
The deck with illustration cards is shuffled and each player is given 6 cards in his hands.

The player makes an association.

Each turn one of the players becomes the leader. The presenter makes an association on one of his cards, tells the association out loud to the other players and puts the hidden card upside down on the table. Each player puts out one card, the most suitable for the voiced association. Then the cards are mixed and laid out in a row.

Guessing the leader’s card.

The main task of the players is to guess which of the cards laid out on the table the presenter has guessed, and to vote for her. Each player selects one voting card with the desired number and puts it face down. The host does not vote or comment on the pictures posted on the table. You cannot vote for your own picture. When everyone made a decision and voted, the voting cards are turned over and points are scored.

Scoring

Players move their chips on the playing field by the number of steps corresponding to the number of points won.

Name: Soap Opera Pursual
Description:
A simple answer the question proceed round the board game answering questions from 7 categories collecting a complete set of characters your chosen soap soaps covered are
Green - Dallas
Pink - Eastenders
Blue - Dynasty
Orange - Brookside
Yellow - Coronation Street
Purple - Crossroads
Beige - Emmerdale Farm

—user summary

Name: Spellandia
Description:
Hidden deep in the Lexis Sea is the volcanic island of Spellandia. It’s a mythical landscape where its volcano spews letters and its islanders collect myriad words by navigating paths littered with these letters. Collecting words is the islanders’ sole occupation.

Spellandia is the tabletop game of making words on a constantly changing, multi-dimensional island comprising up to 54 land tiles with 162 letter fragments. Six islander tokens maintain player positions, with six scoreboards tracking individual scores.

Players explore and expand the island, laying and swapping land tiles, finding paths that form words and moving their tokens to score points. Play continues until a target score is met or exceeded.

—description from the designer

Name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Cult of Yurei Starter Set
Description:
In the shadows and dark corners of the world, the worshippers of Yurei are gathering force. The many members of this Cult may not even be aware that they are serving the same dark masters, but serve them they do – the Yurei Bargain, which in its various forms allows control over life and death, has proven a temptation to many different people who would otherwise have nothing in common. In the Cult of Yurei, you may think yourself the master of your own fate but you are always advancing the unfathomable goals of dark unseen masters. Even a puppet master has someone pulling his strings...

—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Jung Pirates Starter Set
Description:
When years passed without word of the Jung, they were considered lost, their return under the mon of the giant squid surprised everyone. They have reaped what they need from the traders on the seas of the Jwar Isles, forcing the Shiho to label them pirates. Their fleets are faster and their knowledge of the Isles’ waters are unparalleled by all but perhaps the Carp clan, allowing them to evade the larger, less experienced junks of the Prefecture. Long years away from the courts of the Jwar Isles have left the Jung rough around the edges but they have not forgotten their ancestry.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ponle Acento: Un juego Ortográfico
Description:
Ponle Acento is a game about Spanish orthography. It consists of cards with spelling rules and cards with words. The words have gaps in them where the spelling is difficult.

Each player has three open word cards in front of them. One player draws a rule card and reads it out. Now everyone has to find word cards to which the rule is applicable and put it on top of the rule card. Only two cards can score per turn (from the same or different players), so players have to hurry. Players keep their correctly played cards and can exchange 3 for a victory point. First player to reach 3 victory points is the winner.

Name: Bushido: Risen Sun – The Descension Starter Set
Description:
For countless cycles the elders of the mountain have watched and waited, their quiet vigil in the high places of the world unbroken. Silently they have overseen the rise and fall of innumerable clans, the petty squabbles of mortals bare no relevance to their goal. Gifted with generations of knowledge passed down through the written teachings of the Karasu Shugenja and oral histories of the Koroko Shisai the Tengu hold the secrets of the world in the their high homes.

Now stirred into action, one can only imagine the danger that looms that has rustled the Tengu to war.

—description from the publisher

Name: Banco Imobiliário Express
Description: A super dynamic card game to raise - literally - a lot of money. That's because it works with the dynamics of stealing lots, but with the cards of the properties of the Banco Imobiliário. The goal, of course, is to get as many cards as possible for you.

Name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Silvermoon Trade Syndicate Starter Set
Description:
The thriving port of Jima is the beating heart of the Silvermoon Trade Syndicate’s operations. In recent generations the merchants of the Silvermoon Syndicate have been the trade life blood of the Jwar Isles. Its famed arenas where Buto warriors clash in a brutal dance of Jumo, or the Flower Houses where ones' wildest fantasies can become reality with the touch of a Rose, the Syndicate rules. Some would liken the Silvermoon to the flip of a coin; If lucky you come up in the sun with the Five Fortunes blessing, call it wrong or try and cheat them and you’re likely to end up face down in the dirt!

—description from the publisher

Name: Detetive de Bolso
Description: I think we have a Sherlock Holmes here! Use your observation and agility to recognize traces of an almost perfect crime. Here's a clue: it's a game, minimum of two players, and the goal is to find symbols in common between the board card and the hand card. Prepare the magnifying glass, call your team of investigators and start the searches.

Name: Serengeti
Description:
Serengeti is a tactical game of 8 zebras vs giraffes. Both players start with their 8 pieces around the edge of the board, and each turn move one animal one or two steps. An opponent’s piece is captured by enclosing it with two of your own pieces (“Custodian Capture”).
One wins by having all animals neighboring a central oasis field; or by capturing all pieces from an opponent.

Published as an A5 game card with rules, board and pieces to be cut out yourself.

—user summary

Name: Jogo (das coisas que fiz na) Vida
Description: Ideal for getting to know your group better, it is a game of questions, answers, and bets to reveal funny situations in life. Each card has a different situation, and everyone must vote for how many players in the wheel they believe have already made the situation for the card of the round. Ex: I already rang the bell and ran out. Hopefully someone will be ashamed.

Name: Pakjesavond
Description:
The Dutch game association Ducosim publishes the game magazine Spel!. With this magazine they will publish several 'Spel!enkaarten' (gamecards). These are games which fit on a A5 card. #0025 is Pakjesavond. This is a variant of Omatako.

The game is played on a 3x3 field. Each player has 8 pieces valued from 2 to 6. On a turn, a player must move a piece exactly as many steps (horizontal, vertical or up/down) as the number on it - entering from the player’s side of the board, or from wherever an uncovered piece is on the board. One wins if one controls two towers of equal height of 4 or more.

—user summary

Name: Het Kerstboom-Ballen-Memo-Spel
Description:
The Dutch game association Ducosim publishes the game magazine Spel!. With this magazine they will publish several 'Spel!enkaarten' (gamecards). These are games which fit on a A5 card. #0028 is  Het Kerstboom-Ballen-Memo-Spel.

This is a memory variant played on a Christmas tree shaped board. Each turn, a player slides one Christmas ball as far as it goes in one direction, and then flips it and an adjacent ball open to reveal their colors. If they match, the player scores both. Whomever collects most balls wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Everybuddy
Description:
Everybuddy is a game for 1 - 99 players where everyone simultaneously searches for a flock (a group of 3 cards) across which there are either 0 or 2 birdies or matching color.

It's a speed-matching, pattern recognition game for the whole family!

12 cards are laid out in a grid and each card has a different combination of birds. Players race to find three cards that meet the criteria to make a flock of birdie buddies.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sliders Word Game
Description:
Slide and meld fragments into words in this lasercut word game. The game components include 144 letter, bigram and trigram tiles, each with a point value and a gameboard with angular stands.

Setup: 

     Assemble the board with the stands
     Shuffle and scatter the tiles face down in a random pile
     Grab 30 tiles and randomly stack face up within the slots
         2 players:    30 tiles
         3 players:    50 tiles
         4 players:    70 tiles
         5+ players:    90 tiles
    
     Reserve a pile of face down tiles in a draw pile as per the number of players:
     Set the remaining tiles aside and out of sight.


Game Play: 

     Pull one tile from the bottom of any column, letting the tiles in the column slide down.
     Add a tile from the draw pile face up to the top of same column, except when there is only one tile left which is placed face down as the game-ending mystery tile.
     Attempt to make a word from two or more of your tiles.
     When made, place your word in a separate collection pile.


Ending the Game: The game ends when someone pulls the face down mystery tile. That player gets to use that tile to form a word, if possible. At this point the game ends.

—description from the designer

Name: T RUN: The Ultimate Fun and Strategy Card Game
Description:
T RUN is a fast paced card game for people who like to plan ahead, strategize, or team up! The objective of the game is to use clever tactics to get rid of all your cards first. At the same time, you must get rid of your cards in the correct order to win the game.

The players can use strategies such as taking the lead during opportune moments to get rid of low ranking cards. Or, skipping a turn to conserve high ranking cards which can be used later in the game to outmaneuver opponents. The game gets more intense as players discovering more strategies to win.

The game can be played with an odd or even number of players. Also, the game can be played 1 vs. 1, or team vs. team. Each deck allows up to 7 players at the same time. If you have more than 7 players, just add another deck, and everyone can play at the same time.

—description from the publisher

Name: Seven Meadows: A Tableau-Building Strategy Card Game
Description:
Seven Meadows is a tableau-building strategy card game. The game has a whimsical design that includes beautiful flowers and mystical characters. The objective of the game is to build a tableau (a special arrangement of cards) while avoiding accumulating points. While building the tableau, players can strategically force opponents to accumulate points, or eliminate opportunities for them to advance. The player with the least points accumulated at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Gruntz: Activation Cards
Description:
These activation cards are for use in the Gruntz 15mm SCI-FI Wargame.  
They are printed in a small boardgame size card format for use during a Gruntz game. 
The cards DO NOT come with plastic protection sleeves, the size is Mini American Board Game.

If you enjoy a solo game with a narrative feel, these cards are ideal to help in determining a random activation and also help add to the narrative if you follow the bonus events on the cards.

The cards make a game of Gruntz more dynamic, allowing for alternating activation of units using a random determination.  I find it works great for getting more than 2 players into a game of Gruntz because the random nature of unit activation can involve all players, rather than waiting for the traditional I-GO-U-GO turn sequence.

The main Gruntz 15mm SCI-FI rule book includes rules for using normal playing cards, however the same rules can be used with these cards which also add some interesting chaotic battlefield bonus effects.

—description from the publisher

Name: Check
Description: Check is a fun and fast game where players will write as fast as they can words based on different categories and the sum of two dice. First player to finish writing will say out loud “CHECK”

Name: La Petite Mort: Goodie Nerdz
Description:
A goodie tile for La Petite Mort, representing the author of the game, Davy Mourier, and Monsieur Poulpe in tribute to the television series Nerdz.
This tile is a character card played as a basic game tile, with the Darwin Arward weakness, and three soul points.

Name: M.A.D.
Description:
M.A.D - A game about cold war, hot conflict. and ending the world.

This is a moderate-level strategy game about sneakily building your "superweapon" to eliminate all other players. The manner in which you do this is through interesting and strange research types, the primary examples being physics, biology, psyche, and the occult. It can be easily played with only 2 players, and plays often better with 4 to 6 players. All players must draw and use cards from the same deck, often trading, discarding and stealing from each other to try and get the upper hand!

This game is a 2 phase game - cold war and hot conflict - that is controlled by a central 'Tension" mechanic, placing the pacing and speed at which the game takes place entirely in the hands of the players, where they can force their enemies into a war state, or bring their arms to bear.

Players can, and will, use security tokens and deterrents to disrupt the plans of the other players - because at the end, there can only be one! 
Bluffing, lying and manipulating your competitors is to be expected, and intimidating an opponent to fold is a viable method of playing. It just pays to remember, if you try hard enough, almost any situation can be crawled out of.

—description from the publisher

Name: La Guerra dei Robot
Description:
"Great game of strategy and meditation" 
(Front box short description, translated from italian)

"In a distant galaxy, outside our solar system, there is a merciless war for the conquest of power. 
Robots, commanded by their scientists, waging a terrible unrelenting struggle, whose sole purpose is to win. Their magnetic radiation makes them terrible fighters. 
Scientists from the two fields know this well. They must prove themselves to be real strategists in order to foil the enemy's traps, and to reach the final victory that will bring the winner to the pinnacle of glory and power and that will make him the absolute master of the galaxy."
(Back box description, translated from Italian)

"With magnetic action. 
It is a ruthless war between robots facing each other in a distant galaxy for the absolute domination of space. Each robot has the power to capture opponents by means of built-in magnets. Scientists who control robots and radar antennas will have to be neutralized in order to defeat their opponents. 
It is played in 2 or more players. 
Ages 6 and up." 
(From the Editrice Giochi 1981 catalog, translated from Italian)

Name: Naval Battles CCG: Admiral's Handbook
Description:
The Admiral's Handbook, official game rules for Naval Battles: Customizable Card Game.   
Primary resource for game rules, images and layout.

You are an Admiral aboard your flagship cruiser. 
Your orders are to protect your resources and eliminate all enemy and hostile forces in your vicinity. 
Your enemy: the flagship across the water and he's out for the same purpose.

Customize your plans with strategies that will destroy and eliminate your enemies with ships, special resources, weapons upgrades, defense systems, instant abilities, air support and many elements to explore.

Name: The Exiled: Siege – Hero Cards
Description:
Additional Hero cards available as an add-on in the Kickstarter Campaigns

Comprises "Arsonist", "Favourite" & "Forger" cards Hero Cards

Name: Naval Battles CCG: Cube Game
Description:
You are an admiral aboard a flagship cruiser.  
Your objective is to build and deploy ships, weapons, aircraft and defense systems while protecting your resources from hostile forces.  
Players build decks and face off 1 on 1 or in multiplayer to see who can build the most powerful fleet and sink their opponents' flagships.  
Resource cards give you requisition, which you use to build your units.  
The faster your build up, the more likely you are to win the game.

This pack contains 600 printed cards from the Core set of the game.  
The Core set consists of 237 different cards in 6 main card types; ships, weapons, aircraft, defense, instants and resources.  
Using the official Cube game rules, 6 players can build decks with 90 randomly selected cards and play a multiplayer free-for-all.  
Other formats include Standard constructed format where players build decks containing no more than 3 copies of cards from the game.

The Core set consists of 36 rares, 54 uncommons, 132 commons, and 15 basic resource cards; and the Cube box contains 1 of each rare, 2 of each uncommon, and 3 of each common, plus 60 basic resources.  
These cards have been updated with current errata version 1.1.

—description from the publisher

Name: Arcadia Hills
Description:
Arcadia Hills is soon to be the areas most prestigious residential neighborhood!

With the neighborhood currently undergoing construction, players will each take the role of a contractor who's job is to build as many similar homes in a row as possible by matching colors and patterns. Adding finishing touches like a swimming pool or a nearby park will increase the value of each home and the overall appeal of their street, leading to even more points for the player. After all the cards have been played, the player with the most points will be declared the winner!

Players may choose to battle head to head in a heated race to the finish, team up in a 2v2 cooperative battle for supremacy, or take on the job alone in solo mode!

-description from designer

Name: Harpoon V: Modern Tactical Naval Combat 1955 - 2020
Description:
Harpoon is the flagship of the Admiralty Trilogy Group's games. First published in 1980, it has undergone several major revisions, with the last, Harpoon4.1, being printed in the late 1990s. Although the system has remained fairly stable, naval technology has continued advancing, and there have been further developments in the game systems as  more information has been acquired. Harpoon 5 consolidates this knowledge and standardizes Harpoon with the other products.

The era of modern naval combat began on October 21, 1967 when Egyptian missile boats launched four Soviet made Styx surface-to-surface missiles and sank the Israeli destroyer Eilat at a range of 13.5 nautical miles. The face of naval warfare changed forever!

Harpoon 5 handles all aspects of modern maritime combat: surface, sub-surface, and air. Harpoon 5 is a system of detailed but comprehensible rules covering the many facets of modern naval actions. Consistent rating systems and evaluations of the capabilities of modern naval vessels, aircraft, submarines, and helicopters make it possible to achieve realistic results when simulating known situations, by extension Harpoon 5 also achieves realistic results with hypothetical scenarios.

Harpoon 5 can answer questions like:

Are carriers powerhouses or sitting ducks?
Can transatlantic convoys survive in a modern wartime environment?
In the cat-and-mouse games between US and Russian submarines, which is better?

—description from the publisher

Name: Artillery Duel: An experiment in double blind warfare
Description:
Your enemy lies in wait hidden from your view, but you have the same advantage. 
Every shot you take will help to find your enemy, but you know they're going to shoot back.

But you aren't a stationary target and a wise player can balance between movement, searching and limiting their options.

Artillery Duel is an abstract game of combat that uses only scrap paper for each player.  
It is an experiment in double-blind warfare blending battleship fire mechanics with movement and bluffing to keep your opponent guessing.

     No randomization. Only tactics, and results.
     Use your fire either to track your opponent or to destroy their terrain and limit their movement 
     Three special powers for advanced players to outthink and outshoot their opponent


—description from the publisher

Name: Mackinac Island Treasure Hunt: Card and Board Games
Description:
Explore the second U.S. National Park and Michigan's first State Park in search of historical and natural treasures with this set of 5 games.

Match Me if You Can is an Author's Cards-style card game. Choose natural treasures, historical treasures and/or locations around the Island, then collect the most cards in similar groups by asking for cards from other players or by picking up discarded cards.

The Nature Hike has you searching for the route that will allow you to spot the most natural treasures each turn. Pick a card, roll the die to determine how many habitats you can visit, or if you have encountered an obstacle and must discard cards. A variation adds more player interaction by inviting you to collect observations from other players.

The Scavenger Hunt is a cooperative game where players work together to find a pre-determined set of treasures before Winter arrives. Each turn, roll the die to move toward a revealed Scavenger Hunt destination while observing natural treasures along the way. When you get to the destination, if you can match the hiding place card of the historical treasure there, you collect the treasure. If you can't match it, another player can pick up the treasure later, or give you the card you need to collect it. You exchange natural treasure observations for more hiding place cards. You may also encounter events along the way, either obstacles, opportunities, or a change of season.

The Hide and Seek game tests your memory as each turn reveals the hiding place of historical treasures on the Island that you can collect...if you remember where they are. Each turn, you can add a card to your hand, play a new movement option (that lets you move around the Island faster or slower, depending on the season), play event cards on other players (to slow them down), move to new locations while observing natural treasures (which add points to your score), and hunt for historical treasures (by flipping over a hidden location card around the board - if you are at the location on the card, you keep the treasure and score). Whoever finds the most treasures usually wins.

The Treasure Hunt has you playing the sleuth, asking questions of the other players in order to discover the treasures they have hidden around the Island. Using the same movement and event rules as The Hide and Seek game, this game gives players many opportunities to score points: Visit locations on cards in your hand to score and gain special abilities useful in the hunt. Play historical treasures from your hand to score and help everyone know which treasures are not hidden. Ask yes or no questions of the other players to determine the location and the treasure they have hidden on the Island. Guess the treasure and location correctly to score big, or lose a little if you're wrong.

Choose the experience you want based on the available players (2 to 8 people can play), the amount of time you have, or how much you want to think. While some of the games share common rules and themes (for example, each game features some sort of nature observation), each is a separate game. Cards have information about the Island you can read as you play, though knowledge about the Island is not required to play.

—description from the publisher

Name: To Covet Glory: Modifications to Kiss Me Hardy for Ships under the Rate
Description:
To Covet Glory is a 94 page book that features rules modifications for the TooFatLardies game Kiss Me Hardy. 
It is necessary to own KMH in order to use these modifications. KMH is designed for single ship or large fleet actions with ships that are of the rate (6th rate vessel or larger). 
Small ships of less than twenty guns tend to play the same from a one gun rowboat to a 18-gun Brig of War. These modifications provide some uniqueness for the smaller ships and allow them to be battled out on the tabletop.
Like the original KMH rules, they are not scale dependent. 
However, the changes were designed with 1/300 or 6mm ships in mind. 
These can be obtained from sites such as Sea Dog Studios, Langton Miniatures and War Artisan. The later is an exceptional value as you are buying a paper kit that you print yourself and make as many as you would like.

Included in the book is a guide for creating your own ships or creating stats for historical vessels. 
Fifteen historical scenarios covering: the American Revolution, The Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars, The Tripolitan Wars and the Quasi-War with France.

A section is included for creating campaigns with these small vessels.

—description from the publisher

Name: Slam Cup
Description:
Match the cups then slam them down fast! Slam Cup is an intensely fast speed matching game. Match the color on the inside of your cup to the color on the outside of the top cup on the stack. Then slam your cup on top as fast as you can before someone beats you to it!  The first player to stack all their cups is the winner.

—description from the publisher
